slide.title: During the three bouts of blockade, miscreants set fire to tracks and rail bridges at 85 points, ripped off tracks and fishplates at 64 points and halted 91 trains midway across the country.
Earlier this year, railway incurred a loss of about Tk 26 crore due to attacks by Jamaat-Shibir men after their leader Delawar Hossain Sayedee was sentenced to death for war crimes.
“The damage railway has suffered is estimated to be no less than Tk 10 crore,” Abu Taher, director general of Bangladesh Railway, told The Daily Star.
